answers.answer: Hi,TSH is not a really good measure of thyroid function.She obviously needs to be on thyroid meds regardless of what the TSH says - as her symptoms and FT4 clearly point to being hypothyroid.Does she have diabetes?  For many people with diabetes (especially) TSH is apparently even less useful than normal (as a screening tool).
no diabetes.  SO despite the tsh, because the ft4 is low, she needs the meds, agreed?

I agree...TSH isn't worth the powder to blow it to hell most times.  So, yes, despite TSH, it looks like she could benefit from meds...at least a trial dose to see if it helps.She should also have TGab tested.  Some people with Hashi's only test positive for TGab, and some don't test positive for either (in which case FNA can confirm Hashi's).Are they doing anything with the nodules?

Yes, I believe she shoul be on meds.FT3 and FT4 should always be used as the gold standard by which to treat and medicate hypothyroid.TSH is sometimes helpful, but more often than not just confuses the picture as those doctors who only look as TSH may completely miss that a patient really is hypothyroid.Actually proper diagnosis takes into account symptoms and signs, FT3 and FT4, and only then TSH (and only if it's congruent with what everything else says).

At the very worst I would want to repeat her labs (Ft3, FT4, TSH and the antibodies that weren't done) in 2 weeks.  IF Ft3 and FT4 were still low end of range or below range I would start her on low dose thyroid meds and observe and retest after 6 weeks for further adjustment, with target being to get FT3 and FT4 at least middle of the reference range.
the girl has 5-6 cysts on her thyroid that were not there a year ago.  Even if the tgab and tpo come back negative, isnt that grounds in itself for a TT?
No...it would depend on the size of the cysts, their composition and characteristics, etc.  Multiple nodules aren't unusual.

question: a friend of mine has been sick for a long time.   She has had a lot of weight gain.  SHe recently had a sonogram that showed 6 nodules in her thyroid, but she says she tests negative for TPO.  However, her last labs are:TSH 1.99 (Range: 0.40 - 4.50 )Free T4 0.9 (Range: 0.8 - 1.8 )I didnt get the FT3,  but even still, how could her tsh be beautiful, and the ft4 be in the dumpster?    any ideas?
title: weird labs question
